publicationStmt.p: We plan to publish this edition of The Hound of the Baskervilles in June 2025.

availability.p: Held by UW Special Collections under the call number 051 SM v.22.

projectDesc.p: This edition was created as part of TXTDS 404 at the University of Washington over the course of Spring Quarter 2025. Our first goal with this digital edition is to reproduce the copytext as close to the original as possible, including text itself as well as form, format, and illustrations, using the tools of digital editing such as XML, TEI, HTML, and CSS. Our second goal is to include interesting contextual information to the story to enrich and contextualize a reader's experience by connecting readers with Doyleâ€™s history with The Strand and also to the geographic elements in the story and its mediation. We are also interested in how historic audiences received and reacted to the story. Our edition, including our HTML and CSS formatting of the TEI encoding, was published online using the Vergil web publishing system.

editorialDecl.p: Our aim with editiorial decisions is to avoid altering the text and its presentation minimally. Original spelling, format, and punctuation is recreated wherever we can. We will normalize certain punctuation that resembles em dashes and dashes but are neither.
